unit_learning_outcomes.description: Communicate project outcomes, in written and verbal forms, to a variety of audiences.
Apply core knowledge from their discipline to the solution of a real world problem.
Demonstrate leadership and management skills to achieve team deliverables.
Plan and implement a project, including the design of necessary processes, information management and records keeping.
Work effectively, constructively and safely, as an individual and as part of a team, applying knowledge of ethical principles and professional conduct.
Analyse a complex sustainability problem and propose a solution to an instance of that problem.

enrolment_rules.description: Bachelor of Advanced Science and Permission by Special Approval

assessments.description: Detailed description of problem and plan to address it
Assessment of the extent of active and consistent participation in activities and workshops held.
Individual journal showing evidence of work, including demonstration of leadership and group management
Final project report detailing proposed solution
The pitch will be conceptually aimed at investors and backers to demonstrate the worth and feasibilty of the proposed projects

data.description: In this unit students undertake a large scale project applying Science and Technology to a significant real world problem. Students will work in groups to select a topic area and develop innovative and practical solutions to their chosen problem. Project topics will be chosen from across the spectrum of challenges facing modern society, such as sustainable development, climate change, resource management, data security, health and global decision making and other areas identified in the UN sustainability goals.  The project groups will consist of second and third year students, with the students enrolled in this unit providing leadership to their groups.
data.title: Advanced STEM III
